author: .fjl
content: We have some mechanisms in place, but it is mostly implementation details. There are the IP limits and some specific validation rules that should be in all implementations.

author: .fjl
content: There is no general solution to the sybil problem

author: .fjl
content: The way I see it, we can only attempt to ensure nodes in discovery are reachable and behave according to protocol

author: .fjl
content: The discovery protocol is a public database of all existing nodes

author: .fjl
content: It should be reasonably hard to enlist totally fake information

author: .fjl
content: In order to be shared by other nodes, a node must be reachable on the signed endpoint they are advertising. Our validation rules should guarantee that.

author: .fjl
content: If you put in the effort to add sybils into the network, the question would be what you'd even get for that
